question: McClane residence. Lucy McClane speaking.
answer: Hello, Lucy McClane. This is your mother.

question: Mommy! When are you coming home?!
answer: Soon. You'll be in bed when I get there, though.

question: Will you come say 'good night'?
answer: Don't I always, you goose? Now put Paulina on the line, and no searching the house for presents!

question: I didn't look in the front closet under the steps! Is Daddy coming home with you?
answer: Well, we'll see what Santa and Mommy can do. Goose, put Paulina on, okay? I'm working on it. Did Mr. McClane call? * Well...maybe there wasn't time before * the flight. You should probably make up the spare room just in case.

question: California. I'm John McClane.
answer: Argyle. I'm your limo driver. Hey, nice bag.

question: Argyle. Don't you take this stuff?
answer: Do I? I'm sorry. You're gonna have to help me, man. This is my first time driving a limo.

question: That's okay. This is my first time riding in one.
answer: Just kick back and relax, man. We got everything you need If your friend is hot to trot...I know a couple of mama bears. ...Or is he married?

question: Married.
answer: The girl was off today. Hey, I didn't expect you to sit up front. So, your lady live out here?

question: The past six months.
answer: Meanwhile, you still live in New York?

question: You're nosey, you know that, Argyle?
answer: Hey, I'm sorry. When I was a cabdriver, see, people expected a little chit chat, a little eccentricity and comaraderie, I forgot how stuck up you limo guys were, so excuse me.

question: It's okay, it's okay.
answer: So, you divorced of what?

question: She had a good job, it turned into a great career.
answer: But meant her moving here.

question: Closer to Japan. You're fast.
answer: So, why didn't you come?

question: 'Cause I'm a New York cop who used to be a New York kid, and I got six months backlog of New York scumbags I'm still trying to put behind bars. I don't just get up and move.
answer: You mean you thought she wouldn't make it out here and she'd come crawling on back, so why bother to pack?

question: Like I said, Argyle...you're fast.
answer: Mind if I play some tunes?

question: How 'bout some Christmas music?
answer: That is Christmas music. So, you go on upstairs to the party, your lady sees you, you run into each other's arms. Music comes up, you live happily ever after, that it?

question: It's corny, but I could live with it.
answer: What is it don't work out that way? Where you gonna stay?

question: I'll find someplace.
answer: Tell you what. I'll pull into the parking garage and wait. You score with your wife give me a call on the car phone and I'll leave your bags inside at the desk. You strike out... I'll get you to a hotel.

question: You're all right, Argyle.
answer: Just remember that when you sign for the tip. They're paying for it, so don't be shy.

question: Holly McClane? Cute toy. Thirtieth floor... * Lots of hardware... California... Excuse me, I'm looking for --
answer: Holly Gennero?

question: Yeah. How'd you know?
answer: I've spent half my life on airplanes, * I can recognize someone who just got off one. I'm Joe Takagi, Mr. McClane. I have ...something to do with this company.

question: So I've heard.
answer: Holly went to the Vault room to FAX some documents...she should be back any...

question: Ellis, this is John McClane... Holly's policeman? Ellis is in charge of International Acquisitions.
answer: That explains the recent deal with Bolivia. Relax, Ellis. I'm off duty.

question: Can I get you anything? Food? Cake? Watered down champagne punch?
answer: I'm fine. You throw quite a party. I didn't know they had Christmas in Japan.

question: Nice, but one of us is three hours out of sync. I think it's me. Is there a place I can wash up?
answer: Sure. Follow me.

question: Son-of-a-bitch. It works.
answer: What are you doing?

question: It's a long story. You know, I think that Ellis has his eye on you.
answer: That's okay... ... I have an eye on his private bathroom. So, where are you staying? This * all happened so fast I didn't even ask you on the phone.

question: Well, Cappy Roberts retired out here a couple years ago. He said I could bunk with him.
answer: Oh...Where does he live?

question: Ramona...no, Pomona, that's it.
answer: Pomona! You'll be in the car the whole time...Look, let's make this easy. I have a spare bedroom. It's not huge, but the kids would love to have you at the house.

question: They would, huh?
answer: I would too. * They lock eyes for a moment, but it's an intense moment that says a lot about how they still feel about each other. ...I've missed you. *

question: Especially my name. You must miss it every time you write a check. When did you start calling yourself 'Ms. Gennero'?
answer: This is a Japanese company, you know? They figure a married woman, she's on the way out the door...

question: Sure. It's unnerving. I remember this one particular married woman, she went out the door so fast there was practically a jetwash...I mean, talk about your wind chill factor...
answer: Didn't we have this same conversation in July? Damn it, John, there was an opportunity out here -- I had to take it --

question: No matter what it did to our marriage -- ?
answer: My job and my title and my salary did nothing to our marriage except change your idea of what it should be.

question: Oh, here it comes. One of those 'meaningful relationship conversations.' I never should've let you get those magazine subscriptions --
answer: You want to know my idea of a marriage? It's a partnership where people help each other over the rough spots -- console each other when there's a down...and when there's an up, well, hell, a little Goddamn applause or an attaboy wouldn't be too bad. I needed that, John. I deserved that. Thanks, Ginny. I'll be a second. Oh, this is --

question: Hi. John Gennero here. I'm the sensitive and supportive man of the eighties.
answer: I'll be a few minutes. Wait here --

question: Argyle...?
answer: Hey, John, what's the word on you and your lady?

question: What do you want, 'All My Children'? We're making progress. After I get my foot out of my mouth, we'll really be cooking, and then I can --
answer: What?...Mr. Mac, you there? Well, call me back, John. You got the number.

question: Nice suit. John Philips...London? I have two myself. I'm told Arafat shops there too... It's beautiful. I always enjoyed models as a boy. The exactness, the attention to every foreseeable detail... perfection.
answer: This is what this is about? Out building project in Indonesia? Contrary to what you people think, we're going to develop that region... not 'exploit' it.

question: I believe you. I read the article in Forbes. * Mr. Takagi, we could discuss industrialization of men's fashions all day, but I'm afraid my associate, Mr. Theo, has some questions for you. Sort of fill-in-the blanks questions actually...
answer: I don't have that code...! You broke in here to access out computer?!? Any information you could get -- they wake up in Tokyo in the morning, they'll change it! You won't be able to blackmail our executives or threaten --

question: SIT DOWN! Mr. Takagi...I'm not interested in your computer. I'm interested in the 640 million dollars in negotiable bearer bonds you have in you vault. Yes...I know about them. The code key is a necessary step in accessing the vault.
answer: You want...money? What kind of terrorists are you?

question: Who said we were terrorists? The code key, please...?
answer: It's useless to you! There's seven safeguards on our vault, and the code key is only one of them! You'll never get it open!

question: If out plan works...the FBI will get rid of it for us.
answer: Why the fuck didn't you stop him? Because, you ignorant sonofabitch, you'd be dead, too. Think...think, Goddamnit! C'mon, baby...come to Papa. I'm gonna kiss your Goddamn dalmatian.

question: Call 911, give them the name and badge number on your uniform and cancel the alarm...then disable the system. Eddie? What floor did the alarm go off?
answer: Son of a bitch... Freeze, Police...don't move or name your beneficiary. Yeah? Why not? Yeah. My Captain keeps telling me the same thing. Let's go. A million terrorists in the world and I kill the one with feet smaller than my sister.

question: What's happening?
answer: They don't look happy...something's gone wrong.

question: The police...?
answer: John.

question: John? Christ, he could fuck this whole thing up...what does he think he's doing?
answer: How about his job?

question: His 'job' is 3000 miles away. Without him, they might let us go...at least we have a chance...
answer: Tell that to Mr. Takagi.

question: We got an emergency call that there was a problem here.
answer: All right! Where's the fucking cavalry? Come on, come on...who's in that car, Stevie Wonder? Drop it or you're a rugstain.

question: Screw this.
answer: Thanks for the advice.

question: Sorry to water your time. Merry Christmas.
answer: Oh, man, please, no --

question: One Adam Ten to 6421. We had a wild goose chase on that 436. Everything's okay here. Over. 'Oh, the weather outside is frightful, but the...the uh, dum, de dum's delightful...' Roger. '...let is snow, let it snow, let it snow -- ' -- Jesus H. Christ! 6421, this is One Adam Ten -- One Adam Ten, under automatic rifle fire at Nakatomi! Requesting immediate backup and SWAT assistance...
answer: Welcome to the party, pal.

question: -- all of you, stay at your posts! We knew that police action was inevitable... ...In fact, it's necessary. So let them start their feeble efforts; until them, stay calm. We have the hostages, remember. We are still in charge. I told all of you...I want radio silence until further --
answer: Gee, I'm sorry, Hans, nobody gave me the message. You shoulda put it on the bulletin board. Anyway, I thought you and Franco and Karl and the other boys might be lonely, now that I waxed Tony and Marco and their buddy. So I invited some of the guys from my card game.

question: Ah, how nice of you to call. I assume you are our mysterious party crasher. You are most troublesome for a...security guard?
answer: BZZZ! Sorry, Hans, wrong guess. Would you like to go for Double Jeopardy, where the stakes are double and the scores really change? Bad for your health anyway.

question: Who are you, then?
answer: Just the fly in the ointment, Hans. The monkey in the wrench, the pain in the ass -

question: Check on all the others...don't use the radio. See if he's lying about Marco and find out if anyone * else is missing. * Mr. Mystery Guest. Are you still there?
answer: I wouldn't think of leaving, Hans. Unless you want to open the front door...?

question: I'm afraid not. But you have me at a loss -- you know my name, but who are you? Just another American who saw too many movies as a child. Another orphan of a bankrupt culture who thinks he's John Wayne...Rambo... Marshal Dillion.
answer: Actually, I was always partial to Roy Rogers. I really dug those sequined shirts.

question: Do you really think you have a chance against us, Mr. Cowboy?
answer: Yipee-yi-yea...mother-fucker.

question: He had the detonators! Theo? Theo!
answer: Yo!

question: We may have some problems. How is your schedule?
answer: Three down, four to go --

question: Figuring there's at least one to cover the lobby, a couple with the hostages...I'd say they came in with about a dozen...but they're down to nine now, including the skydiver you already met. These guys are mostly Europeans, judging by their clothing labels, and they're well financed and very slick.
answer: How do you know?

question: I've seen enough phoney ID's in my time to recognize that the ones they've got cost a fortune. Add all that up and I don't know what the fuck it means, but these are bad ass preps and they're here to stay.
answer: I hear you... Partner. And LA's finest are on it, so light 'em if you got 'em.

question: I'm ahead of you...partner.
answer: Uh, what do I call you?

question: 'Roy'.
answer: Got it...'Roy'. Now listen. If you think of anything else you think we need to know, don't be shy, okay? In the meantime I want you to find a safe place and hole-up and let us do our job. Understand?

question: Who's talking to them?
answer: I am, Sir...Sergeant Al Powell.

question: Dwayne Robinson. Well, what have you learned? What do they want?
answer: The terrorists? Don't know, Sir. We haven't heard a peep from them.

question: Then who the hell have you been talking too?
answer: We don't exactly know, Sir. He won't give us him name. He appears to be the man who called in the report...he's killed one of the terrorists for sure and claims he capped two others.

question: He claims? Powell, has it occured to you he could be one of the terrorists, pulling your chain? Or some kind of nut case who --
answer: I don't think so, Sir. In fact... I think he's a cop. Maybe not LAPD, but definitely a badge.

question: How do you know?
answer: A hunch. Things he said. Like, knowing how to recognize a phony

question: I...have a request.
answer: Oh? What idiot put you in charge?

question: You did. You murdered by Boss. Now... They're looking to me. Personally I'd pass on the jab. I don't enjoy being this close to you.
answer: Go on.

question: We have a pregnant woman out there -- -- relax, she's not due for two weeks, but a marble floor isn't doing her back any good. I'd like permission for her to more to one of the offices where there's a sofa.
answer: No. But I'll have a sofa brought out to you. Good enough?

question: Good enough. And unless you like is messy, you'd better start taking us in groups to the bathroom.
answer: Yes, you're right. It will be done. Mr. Takagi chose his people well, Mrs...?

question: What's going on?
answer: What's it look like? We're going in.

question: Going in...are you out of your mind? There's 30 hostages in there -- for all we know --
answer: -- all we know? We don't know shit, Powell. If there's hostages why hasn't anyone asked for ransom? If there's terrorists, where's their goddamn list of demands? All we know is that someone shot up your car, and it could be the same flake you've been talking to on the radio!

question: What about the body that fell out of the window -- ?
answer: Who the hell knows? Maybe he was a stockbroker who looked at the Dow Jones and opted for early retirement!

question: Al! Al, the guys in the car, did they make it?
answer: Safe and sound, thanks to you. What the fuck was that?

question: The plastique I found. Is the building on fire?
answer: No, but it's gonna need one hell of a paint job and a shitload of screen doors. One spotters say you got two with that blast.

question: (reaching for Powell's
answer: Glass, my ass! Who the fuck is this?

question: This is Deputy Chief of Police Dwayne T. Robinson, and I'm in charge of this situation.
answer: Well, from up here, it looks like you're in charge of shit, Dwayne. I haven't seen such a fucked up operation since the Bride of Frankenstein. Ask the guys in the armored car if they minded a little flying glass.

question: Listen asshole -- !
answer: Asshole? I'm not the one who just for butt fucked on national TV, Dwayne! Now if you're not part of the solution, stop being part of the problem! Get off the Goddamn radio and put Al back on!

question: Hope I'm not interrupting...?
answer: What does he want?

question: It's not what I want, it's what I can give you. Look, let's be straight, okay? It's obvious you're not some dumb thug up here to snatch a few purses, am I right?
answer: You're very perceptive.

question: Hey, I read the papers, I watch 60 minutes, I say to myself, these guys are professionals, they're motivated, they're happening. They want something. Now, personally, I don't care about your politics. Maybe you're pissed at the Camel Jockeys, maybe it's the Hebes, Northern Ireland, that's none of my business. I figure, You're here to negotiate, am I right?
answer: You're amazing. You figured this all out already?

question: Hey, business is business. You use a gun, I use a fountain pen, what's the difference? To put it in my terms, you're here on a hostile takeover and you grab us for some greenmail but you didn't expect a poison pill was gonna be running around the building. Hans, baby...I'm your white knight.
answer: I must have missed 60 Minutes. What are you saying?

question: Roy! You all right?
answer: Yeah, just trying to handle some year old twinkies. Yucck. What do they put in these things?

question: 'Sugar, enriched flour, partially hydrogenated vegetable oil, polysorbate 60 and yellow dye #5.'
answer: You sound like a man with a couple of kids.

question: Not yet, the wife in working on our first. You got any kids back on the ranch?
answer: Two. And I'd sure like to see them swinging on the jungle gym with Al junior.

question: Ellis?
answer: John, they're giving me a few minutes to try and talk some sense into you. I know you think you're doing your job, and I can appreciate that, but you're just dragging this thing out. None of us gets out of here until these people can negotiate with the LA police, and they're just not gonna start doing that until you stop messing up the works.

question: Ellis, what have you told them?
answer: I told them we're old friends and you were my guest at the party.

question: Ellis...you shouldn't be doing this...
answer: Tell me about it. All right...John, listen to me... They want you to tell them where the detonators are. They know people are listening. They want the detonators of they're going to kill me.

question: Yeah, I hear you, you fucking moron!
answer: John, I think you could get with the program a little. The police are here now. It's their problem. Tell these guys where the detonators are so no one else gets hurt. Hey, I'm putting my life on the line for you buddy...

question: Goddamn, didn't you hear him! He practically pulled the Goddamned trigger himself -- he gave that man to them --
answer: Christ, can't you read between the lines! He did everything he could to save him...if he gave himself up they'd both be dead!

question: Maybe. And maybe they'd at least be talking to us! Now tell your 'partner' to stay out of it, or so help me if he lives through this I'll put him behind bars myself!
answer: He's alone, tired, hunted, and hasn't seen diddly-squat from us and you think he gives a flying fuck about what you're going to do to him? Robinson, wake up and smell the shit you're shoveling!

question: Anytime you want to go home, Sergeant...consider yourself dismissed.
answer: No Sir. You couldn't drag me away.

question: Al? Al, you there?
answer: I'm here, cowboy.

question: Speaking of cows, did you ever hear so much bullshit in your life? Two hours? That doesn't even make any sense --
answer: Don't tell me, partner. I'm just a desk jockey who was on the way home when you rang.

question: The way you drove that car, I figured you for the streets.
answer: In my youth, partner. In my youth.

question: Lost?
answer: --ohGodplease -- don't kill me -- don't kill me -- you're one of them, I know it --

question: Whoa, whoa, easy man. I won't hurt you. Who are you? What are you looking for?
answer: A way up to the roof...I thought I could signal for help --

question: Forget it. They got a guy up there. You want to stay alive, keep moving. Hey? You hear me?
answer: You...you're an American?

question: There was a party -- celebration -- all of a sudden they were there -- shooting -- threatening us --
answer: Relax, man...you smoke?

question: You...you don't work for Nakatomi... and if you're not one of them...
answer: I'm a cop from New York.

question: New York...
answer: They invited me to the Xmas party. Who knew? Better than being caught with your pants down, right? John McClane.

question: William Clay. Call me Bill.
answer: Bill, you know how to use a handgun?

question: One weekend I went to a combat ranch... You know, that game with the, the guns that shoot red paint? Must sound pretty silly to you...
answer: Sounds better than nothing. Time for the real thing.

question: Karl! Franco! I'm on 33. Come quickly. Put down your gun and give me my detonators.
answer: Hans. Your Hans.

question: Put it down now.
answer: That was tricky, with the accent. I bet you do a great Ed Sullivan. Why do you need the detonators, Hans? I already used the explosives.

question: I'm going to count to three...
answer: Yeah. Like you did with Takagi. You think I'm a shmuch, Hans.

question: Roy? You still with us?
answer: Yeah. But all things being equal, I'd rather be in Philadelphia. By the way, chalk up two more terrorists.

question: They boys'll be glad. We got a pool going on you.
answer: Yeah? What's the odds?

question: You don't want to know.
answer: Put me down for twenty anyway...I'm good for it...so, what got you off the street, Al? You liked lousy coffee, or what?

question: They way you drive, I can see why.
answer: I...I shot a kid. Eleven years ago. Oh, it was dark... he was big for his age...damn ray gun he had looked real enough...yeah, I had all the right excuses...but afterwards... I really couldn't draw my gun again.

question: I...I'm sorry. I didn't mean to make a joke of it.
answer: Hey, you couldn't know.

question: I still feel like shit.
answer: Then this won't matter. LAPD's not calling the shots anymore.

question: Right up the ass. This is Johnson...no the other one. I want that air support ready to lift off in five minutes...Damn right fully armed. We're on our way. Attention in the building.
answer: This is Hans...

question: This is Agent Johnson of the FBI. The State Department has arranged for the release of your comrades. The helicopters you requested are on the way.
answer: I hear you, FBI. We'll be ready. When they touch down and we blow the roof, they'll spend a month sifting through the bodies and rubble. By the time they figure out what went wrong... ...we'll be earning twenty percent like nice fat Capitalists.

question: I'm here, John.
answer: Look...I'm getting a bad feeling up here...I'd like you to do something for me. Look up my wife...don't ask how, you'll know by then...and tell her...tell her...I've been a jerk. When things panned out for her, I should've been behind her all the way ...We had something great going until I screwed it up...She was the best thing that ever happened to a bum like me. She's heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never got to hear this...honey...I'm sorry. You get all that?

question: I got it. But you can tell her yourself. Just watch your ass and you'll make it.
answer: I hope so. But that's up to the guy upstairs. Upstairs... ...Hans, you bastard...what were you doing?

question: Roy?
answer: Stand by, Powell. I gotta check something out.

question: Holly, we have to stop meeting like this. So that's what it was. A fucking robbery. So why nuke the building, Hans?
answer: When you steal six hundred dollars, you can disappear...but when you steal six hundred million, they will find you...unless you play dead. Which happens to be your next role... drop your gun, please. Nein, dies ein ist mein. This time John Wayne does not walk off into the sunset with Grace Kelly.

question: That was Gary Cooper, shithead...
answer: No more jokes, drop it or she gets it between the eyes!

question: Whoa, Hans, now you're the cowboy?
answer: 'Yippe-ki-yea, mother fucker'? Now you are fucked.
